meanings.definition: The act of gathering together or collecting in one place.
meanings.sent1: After the game, there was a roundup of all the equipment on the field.
meanings.sent2: The roundup of supplies for the camping trip took place in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The roundup of toys in the playroom turned into a fun game of sorting.
meanings.sent4: The roundup of books on the shelf was like a treasure hunt for the hidden gems.
meanings.sent5: The roundup of colorful leaves in the yard made a beautiful autumn display.

meanings.definition: A summary or brief overview of a situation or event.
meanings.sent1: Before the meeting, we received a roundup of the main points to be discussed.
meanings.sent2: The news anchor provided a roundup of the day's top stories.
meanings.sent3: The roundup of the movie plot left out all the exciting twists and turns.
meanings.sent4: The roundup of the school year captured all the memorable moments in one page.
meanings.sent5: The roundup of the recipe included all the key ingredients for a delicious dish.

meanings.definition: To bring together or collect in one place.
meanings.sent1: We need to roundup all the chairs for the meeting in the conference room.
meanings.sent2: The cowboys had to roundup the cattle before the storm arrived.
meanings.sent3: Let's roundup all the ingredients before we start cooking the meal.
meanings.sent4: The team worked together to roundup all the data for the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The volunteers helped roundup the donations for the charity event.

meanings.sent1: I just need to roundup the last few paragraphs of my essay.
meanings.sent2: The chef had to roundup the dessert before serving it to the guests.
meanings.sent3: Let's roundup the final details before we launch the project.
meanings.sent4: The students worked hard to roundup their assignments before the deadline.
meanings.sent5: She managed to roundup all her tasks for the day before heading home.
